Hi! I had a problem where users could upload large images which made the app allocate more than 16MB, resulting in a crash. I fixed this using `sampleSize` so now I can no longer reproduce the error. The weird thing is that one of my users is uploading a 3.3MB JPEG and causing this same crash(Crashlytics report 139MB allocated out of 16MB allowed) and I have no idea why. I cannot reproduce this on my Nexus 5x, and we have asked other users with the same phone(Samsung Galaxy S5) to try and upload images and they have no issues with it.
Is there anything I may have overlooked? Thanks!
<@U2HFZ2P4M> How do you use the image? I had similar issues. But the problem ended up being base64 string that was too big for the json string i was sending to the server

Hey guys, would you be interested to try out a new transactional/marketing email/sms/apn management/automation platform (on steroids)? It's loaded with features you won't find in similar products. It is currently by invite only - so please message me if you are interested.
<@U2387RQ85> please post what product it is. You're also better posting it in <#C04PLQMUM|hangout> or <#C04PMDF2P|apps>.

<@U061HDV96> thanks for the info. Will post it there. I am referring to our own new platform that is still in beta. Looking for developers who would be interested to give it a try - for free, obviously.

<@U2387RQ85> yes, and thank you for offering it. But I think it's better to post what it is first so we can judge first. Everyone can say his platform has this and that, but we should see for ourselves.

attachments.title: Home - Translation Exchange
attachments.text: Bring Your Apps to the World Translation Exchange is the Agile Localization Platform For Web and Mobile Applications Get Started For free!   Request a Demo Trusted By These Companies A Complete Toolkit for Web and Mobile Localization Whether you need to localize a mobile app, a complex web service, an online store, or your

text: <@U3E2EEX38> that's our main product. We started by building a localization platform for web and mobile applications. We have integrations for Android as well: <https://github.com/translationexchange?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=android>
Basically the main product allows you to add a few lines of code to your app - and translate it to any language with a few clicks
Then push updated translations over the air to the live application
Is that what you were offering to test?
Or is the test something else?
So along the main product, we've also been focusing on developing a multi-lingual messaging system.
It started as SMTP only. But then we added SMS and APN to the list of channels
Our messaging system allows you to manage message templates (emails, sms, etc). Create campaigns, deliver messages in any languages and much more
It's like a black box - you tell it to deliver a certain template with some data tokens to a specific recipient via a specific channel in a desired language - and it does it all for you
Here is a screenshot of what our drag and drop campaign editor looks like:
<@U2387RQ85|berk> uploaded a file: <https://androidchat.slack.com/files/berk/F3HFG3FFB/screen_shot_2016-12-15_at_6.19.54_pm.png|Screen Shot 2016-12-15 at 6.19.54 PM.png>
It comes with a/b testing of messages and subjects, analytics, multiple providers and senders, etc
we are somewhat similar to Drip - with some specific features unique only to us
the messaging system is by invite only for now. so please send me a message with your email and i will add you in

I seems like its aimed more at large companies, as it stands I would be useless as a tester because I've never used or had a use for a similar product to this, but some people here will probably be interested
That's true, the marketing features are more advanced. But our simple transactional emails are very straight forward.

I don't get how to use MVP if I have to do everything ANdroid related in the view
So you can test your code
I am beginner in MVP as well, the thing about MVP is to separate your entire logic away from your view codes and to Unit Test the business logic as testing in Android is difficult
Also it helps separate user interactions from logic
Imagine we usually do the implementation on the view onClick callback
this is bad as they say, I call an interface method onClick and in turn returns the callback to my Activity (I elect my activities to be controllers)
so my activity has a lot of override methods onClick, onAdd, onDelete etc. etc. its a beauty
once you have the view in place (it is well constructed, modular)  and your view rarely changes (business requirements etc) you simple forgot about it
My presenter is completely decoupled from view
<@U3E2EEX38> I think I read a different tutorial lol

I checked each and every tutorial on Android about MVP and they all say the same thing, what I learned from this chat is just to get to the point of MVP/MVC or whatever they call it, just separate logic from view
